translation: Now begins the description of Fisherman as the Seventh Guru

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੇ ਚਲਾ ਰਾਜ ਸੰਨਯਾਸਾ ॥ ਮਹਾ ਬਿਮਲ ਮਨ ਭਯੋ ੳੁਦਾਸਾ ॥ ਨਿਰਖਾ ਤਹਾਂ ੲੇਕ ਮੱਛਹਾ ॥ ਲਾੲੇ ਜਾਰ ਕਰ ਜਾਤਨ ਕਹਾ ॥੧੯੨॥
transliteration: Aage Chalaa Raaj Sannyaasaa || Mahaa Bimal Man Bhayo Udaasaa|| Nirkhaa Tahaan Ek Machchhahaa|| Laae Jaar Kar Jaatan Kathaa||192||
translation: That great ascetic Dutt, of the pure mind moved further; there he saw a Fisherman going with his net.192.

gurmukhi: ਬਰਛੀ ੲੇਕ ਹਾਥ ਮੋ ਧਾਰੇ ॥ ਜਰੀਅਾ ਅੰਧ ਕੰਧ ਪਰ ਡਾਰੇ ॥ ੲਿਸਥਿਤ ੲੇਕ ਮੱਛਿ ਕੀ ਅਾਸਾ ॥ ਜਾਨੁਕ ਵਾ ਕੇ ਮੱਧ ਨ ਸਾਸਾ ॥੧੯੩॥
transliteration: Barchhiek Haath Mo Dhdare|| Dareeaa Andh Kandh Par Dare|| Isthit Ek Machchh(i) Kiaasaa|| Jaanouk Vaa Ke Madhh Na Saasaa||193||
translation: He was holding his lance in one of his hands and was carrying the net on one shoulder; he was standing there for the sake of the fish in such a way as if his body had become breathless.193.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਸੁ ਠਾਂਢ ਮੱਛ ਕੀ ਅਾਸੂ ॥ ਰਾਜ ਪਾਟ ਤੇ ਜਾਨ ੳੁਦਾਸੂ ॥ ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧ ਨੇਹ ਨਾਥ ਸੌ ੲੀਅੈ ॥ ਤਬ ਹੀ ਪੂਰਨ ਪੁਰਖ ਕਹ ਪੲੀਅੈ ॥੧੯੪॥
transliteration: Ek Su Thaandh Machchh Kiaasoo|| Raaj Paat Te Jaan Udaasoo|| Eh Bidh Neh Naath Sau Laeeeeai|| Tab Hipooran Purakh Kah Paeeeeai||194||
translation: He was standing with the desire of catching one fish in such a way as if someone standing with patience and detached from all his paraphernalia; Dutt thought that if such a love was observed for the sake of the Lord, then that perfect Purusha i.e. the Lo
End of the description of the adoption of Fisherman as the seventh Guru.
Now begins the description of he adopt of Maid-servant as the Eighth Guru

gurmukhi: ਹਰਖਤ ਅੰਗ ਸੰਗ ਸੈਨਾ ਸੁਨ ॥ ਅਾਯੋ ਦੱਛ ਪ੍ਰਜਾਪਤਿ ਕੇ ਮੁਨ ॥ ਤਹਾਂ ੲੇਕ ਚੇਰਕਾ ਨਿਹਾਰੀ ॥ ਚੰਦਨ ਘਸਤ ਮਨੋ ਮਤਵਾਰੀ ॥੧੯੫॥
transliteration: Harkhat An San Sainaa Soun|| Aayo Dachchh Prajaapat(i) Ke Mounnd| Tahaan Ek Cherkaa Nihdaree|| Channdan Ghasat Mano Matvdaree||195||
translation: When the sage Dutt reached the abode of Daksha Prajapati, he was greatly pleased alongwith his army; there the sage Dutt saw a maid-servant, who, being intoxicated, was rubbing the sandalwood.195.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਘਸਤ ਨਾਰ ਸ਼ੁਭ ਧਰਮਾ ॥ ੲੇਕ ਚਿਤ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਅਾਪਨ ਘਰ ਮਾ ॥ ੲਿਕ ਚਿੱਤ ਨਹੀ ਚਿੱਤ ਚਲਾਵੈ ॥ ਪ੍ਰਿਤਮਾ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਲਜਾਵੈ ॥੧੯੬॥
transliteration: Channdan Ghasat Naar Shoubh Dharmaa|| Ek Chit Hvai Aapan Ghar Maa|| Ik Chitt Nahichitt Chalaavai|| Pritmaa Chitra Bilok Lajaavai||196||
translation: That lady of good conduct was grinding sandalwood single-mindedly in her home; she had concentrated her mind and seeing her even the portrait was getting shy.196.

gurmukhi: ਦੱਤ ਲੲੇ ਸੰਨਯਾਸਨ ਸੰਗਾ ॥ ਜਾਤ ਭਯੋ ਤਹ ਭੇਟਤ ਅੰਗਾ ॥ ਸੀਸ ੳੁਚਾੲਿ ਨ ਤਾਸ ਨਿਹਾਰਾ ॥ ਰਾਵ ਰੰਕ ਕੋ ਜਾਤ ਬਿਚਾਰਾ ॥੧੯੭॥
transliteration: Datt Lae Sannyaasan Sanad|| Jaat Bhayo Tah Bhaatat Anad|| Sees Ouchaae Na Taas Nihaaraa|| Raav Rank Ko Jaat Bichaaraa||197||
translation: Dutt went that way alongwith the Sannyasis in order to meet her, but she did not raise her head and see whether some king or some pauper was going.197.

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕੋ ਦੱਤ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਪ੍ਰਭਾਵਾ ॥ ਅਸ਼ਟਮ ਗੁਰੂ ਤਾਹਿ ਠਹਰਾਵਾ ॥ ਧੰਨਿ ਧੰਨਿ ੲਿਹ ਚੇਰਕਾ ਸਭਾਗੀ ॥ ਜਾ ਕੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਨਾਥ ਸੰਗਿ ਲਾਗੀ ॥੧੯੮॥
transliteration: Taa Ko Datt Bilok Prabhaavaa|| Ashtam Guroo Taah(i) Thahraavaa|| Dhann(i) Dhann(i) Eh Cherkaa Sabhaagee|| Jaa Kipreet Naath San(i) Laagee||198||
translation: Seeing her impact, Dutt accepted her as the eighth Guru and said, “Blessed is this maid-servant, who is absorbed in love with that Lord.”198.
